properties.areaDesc: Waters from Jupiter Inlet to Deerfield Beach FL from 20 to 60 NM; Coastal waters from Deerfield Beach to Ocean Reef FL out 20 NM; Waters from Deerfield Beach to Ocean Reef FL from 20 to 60 NM excluding the territorial waters of Bahamas
properties.headline: Special Marine Warning issued February 1 at 1:58AM EST until February 1 at 3:00AM EST by NWS Miami FL
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Miami has issued a

* Special Marine Warning for...
Coastal waters from Deerfield Beach to Ocean Reef FL out 20 NM...
Waters from Deerfield Beach to Ocean Reef FL from 20 to 60 NM
excluding the territorial waters of Bahamas...
Waters from Jupiter Inlet to Deerfield Beach FL from 20 to 60 NM...

* Until 300 AM EST.

* At 158 AM EST, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing
waterspouts was located 30 nm east of Surfside, moving northeast at
25 knots.

HAZARD...Waterspouts and wind gusts to 40 knots.

SOURCE...Radar.

IMPACT...Waterspouts can easily overturn boats and create locally
hazardous seas. Small craft could be damaged in briefly
higher winds and suddenly higher waves.

* The severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly open waters.
properties.instruction:
Move to safe harbor immediately as gusty winds and high waves are
expected.

Report severe weather to the Coast Guard or the National Weather
Service. You can also share your report with NWS Miami on Facebook
and Twitter.
